text: thumb|right|250px|Rail bridge over the Garden River. The Garden River is a river in the Algoma District of Ontario, Canada. The rivers source is Garden Lake from which it empties into the St. Marys River east of Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario. The river gets its name from vegetable gardens kept by the Ojibwa people in this area. The Garden River First Nation Reserve is located in this area. ==See also== *List of Ontario rivers Category:Rivers of Algoma District
title: Garden River (Ontario)
